lfoptions.group:
# options to turn hydrological modules on/off
# use inflow data
# option to compute indicators
# option to initialize Lisflood
# option to read/write NetCDF

# report discharge TS
# report gauges and sites
# report reservoirs and lakes

# report state maps
# report end maps
# report maps

group.comment: Optimization of netCDF I/O through chunking and caching

textvar.name: NetCDFTimeChunks
textvar.comment: The option "NetCDFTimeChunks" may take the following values: - "-1" : Load everything upfront - "[positive integer number]" : Chunk size defined by user - "auto" : Let xarray to decide

textvar.name: MapsCaching
textvar.comment: The option "MapsCaching" may take the following values: - "True" : Cache maps during execution - "False" : No caching

textvar.name: OutputMapsChunks
textvar.comment: The option "OutputMapsChunks" may take the following values: - "[positive integer number]" : Dump outputs to disk every X steps (default 1)

textvar.name: OutputMapsDataType
textvar.comment: The option "OutputMapsDataType" sets the output data type and may take the following values: - "float64" - "float32"

textvar.name: numCPUs_parallelKinematicWave
textvar.comment: !-- Parallelisation of the kinematic wave routing (via openMP multi-threading). The option "numCPUs_parallelKinematicWave" may take the following values: - "0" : auto-detection of the machine/node's number of CPUs (all CPUs are used minus 1) (do not set it if other simulations are running on the same machine/node) - "1" : serial execution (not parallel) - "2", "3", ... : manual setting of the number of parallel threads. (if exceeding the number of CPUs, the option is set to "0") -->

textvar.name: numCPUs_parallelNumba
textvar.comment: !-- Parallelisation of using Numba runtime compiled library . The option "numCPUs_parallelNumba" may take the following values: - "0" : set to NUMBA_NUM_THREADS Environment Variable (if NUMBA_NUM_THREADS is not set, will take the number of CPU cores determined by python's multiprocessing.cpu_count()) - "1" : serial execution (not parallel) - "2", "3", ... : manual setting of the number of parallel threads. (if exceeding NUMBA_NUM_THREADS, the value is set to NUMBA_NUM_THREADS) -->

textvar.name: proj4_params
textvar.comment: This is necessary when using projected coordinates (x,y)

textvar.name: MaskMap
textvar.comment: Boolean map with the catchment extent /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/areawithdeadsea.map /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/work/DrinaMask.map /sbsDrina/DrinaMask.map /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood/area /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/staticMaps/areawithdeadsea.map /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/hprot/sbs/pontelagoscuro_sbs.map 70 40 0.1 -8.6 43.3 # Douro 30 30 0.1 6.0 52.0 Clone map col row cellsize xupleft yupleft 300 200 0.1 -15 25 -> Niger 3600 1500 0.1 -180 90 -> World $(PathRoot)\areamaps\areaEurope.map $(PathRoot)\areamaps\AreaPo.map or pcraster maps or netcdf maps, e.g. Rhine areaLobith.map Niger areaLokoja.map Po areaPo.map Danube areaDanube.map Sava areaSava.map

textvar.name: Gauges
textvar.comment: Nominal map with gauge locations, i.e., cells for which simulated discharge is written to file(1,2,3, etc) lat lon (lat2 lon2 ...) or pcraster maps or netcdf maps ./mapsNetcdf/maps/outlets_World.map $(PathMaps)/outlets.map e.g. Lobith/Rhine 6.15 51.85 Bratislava/Danube 17.15 48.15 Niger/Lokoja 6.75 7.85 0.45 15.65

textvar.name: netCDFtemplate
textvar.comment: netcdf template used to copy metadata information for writing netcdf $(PathEvapo)/$(PrefixE0)

textvar.name: Latitude
textvar.comment: latitude map to be used for snow/ice modelling

textvar.name: CalendarConvention
textvar.comment: Calendar convention

textvar.name: CalendarDayStart
textvar.comment: Reference day and time

textvar.name: StepStart
textvar.comment: Date and time of the first time step in the simulation

textvar.name: StepEnd
textvar.comment: Date and time of the last time step in the simulation

textvar.name: timestepInit
textvar.comment: If initial condition are stored as netCDF with different time steps. this variable indicates which time step to use, either as a date e.g. 1/1/2010 or as a number e.g. 5

textvar.name: ReportSteps
textvar.comment: Timesteps at which to write model state maps (i.e. only those maps that would be needed to define initial conditions for succeeding model run). Three ways to define it: * specific timesteps: "10,20,40" * regular timesteps: "start+increment..end" "1..9999" * last timestep: "endtime"

textvar.name: DtSec
textvar.comment: timestep [seconds]

textvar.name: DtSecChannel
textvar.comment: Sub time step [seconds] used for kinematic wave channel routing Within the model,the smallest out of DtSecChannel and DtSec is used 14400 -> 4 h timestps

textvar.name: EnsMembers
textvar.comment: Number of sample to use in MonteCarlo simulations

textvar.name: nrCores
textvar.comment: Number of cores of the computer to use in MonteCarlo simulations This only works with Linux, if set to 1 no forking will be used

textvar.name: FilterSteps
PathRoot
textvar.comment: Root directory for maps, tables and parameters

textvar.name: PathWarm
textvar.comment: Output path (org=$(PathRoot)/out)

textvar.name: PathInit
textvar.comment: Directory used to save of the initial value maps. E.g.: lzavin.nc (org=$(PathRoot)/outPo)

textvar.name: PathMaps
textvar.comment: Static maps path /perm/mo/mocm/proj/efas/xdom/data/staticData/lisflood Maps path

textvar.name: PathInflow
textvar.comment: Inflow path

textvar.name: PathParams
textvar.comment: Calibration parameter path

textvar.name: PathTables
textvar.comment: Tables path

textvar.name: PathChannels
textvar.comment: Directory containing the maps related to channel routing

textvar.name: PathLandCover
textvar.comment: Directory containing the maps related to land cover

textvar.name: PathLandUse
textvar.comment: Directory containing maps for land use fractions and related land use maps

textvar.name: PathLandUseChange
textvar.comment: Maps for transient land use changes every 5 years

textvar.name: PathMeteo
textvar.comment: Meteo path ./meteoWatch

textvar.name: PathSoilHyd
textvar.comment: Directory containing the maps related to soil hydraulics

textvar.name: PathTopography
textvar.comment: Directory containing maps related to the topography of the catchment

textvar.name: PathLAI
textvar.comment: Leaf Area Index maps path

textvar.name: PathWaterUse
textvar.comment: Water use maps path $(PathMaps)/waterdemand19902014

textvar.name: PathVarWaterfraction
textvar.comment: variable water fraction maps path

group.comment: with .nc format: than working with smaller sub-areas is possible

textvar.name: UpperZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant [days] for the linear reservoir that represents the upper groundwater zone. This is the average time a water 'particle' remains in the reservoir if we had a stationary system (average inflow=average outflow) default: 10 $(PathParams)/params_UpperZoneTimeConstant.nc

textvar.name: LowerZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant [days] for the linear reservoir that represents the lower groundwater zone. This is the average time a water 'particle' remains in the reservoir if we had a stationary system (average inflow=average outflow) default: 100 $(PathParams)/params_LowerZoneTimeConstant.nc

textvar.name: GwPercValue
textvar.comment: Maximum rate of percolation [mm/day] from the upper to the lower groundwater zones default: 0.5 $(PathParams)/params_GwPercValue.nc

textvar.name: GwLoss
textvar.comment: Maximum percolation rate from the lower groundwater zone [mm/days]. GWLoss it’s lost beyond the catchment boundaries or to deep groundwater systems. A value of 0 (closed lower boundary) is recommended as a starting value. default: 0.0 $(PathParams)/params_GwLoss.nc

textvar.name: LZThreshold
textvar.comment: Water storage [mm] in the lower groundwater zone below which baseflow stops, i.e., the flow from the lower groundwater zone into the river threshold value [mm] of the water storage in the lower groundwater zone.

textvar.name: b_Xinanjiang
textvar.comment: Power coefficient in the Xinanjiang distribution function [-] default: 0.7 [-] $(PathParams)/params_b_Xinanjiang.nc

textvar.name: PowerPrefFlow
textvar.comment: Power that controls the increase of preferential flow with increased soil moisture storage [-] default: 3.5 [-] $(PathParams)/params_PowerPrefFlow.nc

textvar.name: CalChanMan
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to channel Manning's n default: 2.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_CalChanMan1.nc

textvar.name: CalChanMan2
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to channel Manning's n for the second line of routing, i.e., the overbank flow default: 3.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_CalChanMan2.nc

textvar.name: SnowMeltCoef
textvar.comment: Degree-day factor [mm / (°C · day)] in the snow melt process. SRM: 0.45 cm C-1 day-1 ( = 4.50 mm C-1 day-1), Kwadijk: 18 mm C-1 month-1 (= 0.59 mm C-1 day-1) See also Martinec et al., 1998. default: 4.0 [mm C-1 day-1] $(PathParams)/params_SnowMeltCoef.nc

textvar.name: LakeMultiplier
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to the lake parameter alpha that defines outflow: Q = mult · alpha · H² default: 1.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_LakeMultiplier.nc

textvar.name: adjust_Normal_Flood
textvar.comment: Parameter of the reservoir simulation that adjusts the balance between normal and flood storage It ranges between 0.01 and 0.99; larger values results in keeping the outflow longer at normal values (rnormq). default: 0.8 [-] $(PathParams)/params_adjust_Normal_Flood.nc

textvar.name: ReservoirRnormqMult
textvar.comment: Parameter that multiplies the reservoir's normal outflow (rnormq). It ranges 0.5 - 2 default: 1.0 [-] $(PathParams)/params_ReservoirRnormqMult.nc

textvar.name: AvWaterRateThreshold
textvar.comment: Critical amount of available water (expressed in [mm/day]!), above which 'Days Since Last Rain' parameter is set to 1 default: 5.0 [mm/day] (not included in calibration)

textvar.name: QSplitMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier of the average discharge that determines the bankful discharge. Discharge over this bankful value triggers the second line of the kinematic wave routing. THIS NEEDS TO BE AMENDED BY ADDING THE RIGHT PATH TO $(PathParams) default: 2.0 [-]

textvar.name: ChanBottomWMult
textvar.comment: PBchange Multiplier applied to ChanBottomWidth

textvar.name: ChanDepthTMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier [] applied to ChanDepthThreshold

textvar.name: ChanSMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier [] applied to ChanSdXdY

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - leave all these parameters at their default values. In some very special cases CalEvaporation may be set to some value other than one

textvar.name: PrScaling
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to potential precipitation rates

textvar.name: CalEvaporation
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to potential evapo(transpi)ration rates

textvar.name: LeafDrainageTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Residence time [days] of the linear reservoir that represents intercepted water default: 1 [day], all water either evaporates of drains within one day

textvar.name: kdf
textvar.comment: Average extinction coefficient for the diffuse radiation flux. It varies with crop from 0.4 to 1.1 (Goudriaan (1977))

textvar.name: SMaxSealed
textvar.comment: Maximum depression storage for water on impervious surface. This water does not cause surface runoff [mm]

textvar.name: FracMaxWater
textvar.comment: Fraction of maximum extend of water

textvar.name: LakeMask
textvar.comment: Mask with Lakes from GLWD database

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - estimate SnowFactor from prior data (if available), otherwise use 1 - use SnowMeltCoef as a calibration constant - leave all other parameters at default

textvar.name: SnowFactor
textvar.comment: Multiplier [-] applied to precipitation that falls as snow default: 1 [-]

textvar.name: SnowSeasonAdj
textvar.comment: Seasonal variation [mm / (°C · day)] of the degree-day factor, of wich "SnowMeltCoef" is the average value

textvar.name: TempMelt
textvar.comment: Temperature threshold [°C] below which snow melts

textvar.name: TempSnow
textvar.comment: Temperature threshold [°C] below which precipitation occurs as snow

textvar.name: TemperatureLapseRate
textvar.comment: Temperature gradient with altitude [°C / m]. It is actually the opposite of the gradient, since temperature goes down with altitude.

textvar.name: Afrost
textvar.comment: Daily decay coefficient [day-1], (Handbook of Hydrology, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: Kfrost
textvar.comment: Snow depth reduction coefficient, [cm-1], (HH, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: SnowWaterEquivalent
textvar.comment: Snow water equivalent, (based on snow density of 450 kg/m3) (e.g. Tarboton and Luce, 1996)

textvar.name: FrostIndexThreshold
textvar.comment: Frost index threshold above which soil is considered frozen; therefore, infiltration, percolation and capillary rise stop. Molnau and Bissel found a value 56-85 for NW USA.

textvar.name: IrrigationEfficiency
textvar.comment: Field application irrigation efficiency [-]: max 1, ~0.90 drip irrigation, ~0.75 sprinkling Default: 0.75 [-] $(PathMaps)/irrigation_efficiency_baseline.nc

textvar.name: ConveyanceEfficiency
textvar.comment: conveyance efficiency [-]: around 0.80 for average channel

textvar.name: IrrigationType
textvar.comment: IrrigationType (value between 0 and 1) is used here to distinguish between additional adding water until fieldcapacity (value set to 1) or not (value set to 0)

textvar.name: IrrigationMult
textvar.comment: Factor [-] to irrigation water demand More than the transpiration is added e.g to prevent salinisation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseM3
textvar.comment: Annual amount (m3) of treated wastewater reused for irrigation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseNumDays
textvar.comment: Number of days over which the annual amount of treated wastewater for irrigation is used

textvar.name: LivestockConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for livestock water use (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: IndustryConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for industrial water use (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for energy water use (0-1) [-] Source: Torcellini et al. (2003) "Consumptive Use for US Power Production" map advised by Neil Edwards, Energy Industry the UK and small French rivers the consumptive use varies between 1:2 and 1:3, so 0.33-0.50 For plants along big rivers like Rhine and Danube the 0.025 is ok EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction=0.025 $(PathMaps)/energyconsumptiveuse.nc

textvar.name: DomesticConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for domestic water use (0-1) [-] Source: EEA (2005) State of Environment

textvar.name: LeakageFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of leakage on public water supply (0=no leakage, 1=100% leakage) 0.2 $(PathMaps)/leakage.map

textvar.name: LeakageWaterLoss
textvar.comment: The water that is lost from leakage (lost) (0-1) [-]

textvar.name: LeakageReductionFraction
textvar.comment: Leakage reduction fraction (e.g. 50% = 0.5 as compared to current Leakage) (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-]

textvar.name: WaterSavingFraction
textvar.comment: Water savings fraction (e.g. 10% = 0.1 as compared to current Use (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-] scenwsav.map

textvar.name: WaterReUseFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of water re-used in industry (e.g. 50% = 0.5 = half of the water is re-used, used twice (baseline=0, maximum=1) [-] scenruse.map

textvar.name: FirstDayOfMonth
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropCoef
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop coefficient [-]

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop group number [-]

textvar.name: Population
textvar.comment: Population [units]

textvar.name: PopulationMaps
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: LandUseMask
textvar.comment: Land Use Mask

textvar.name: WaterUseMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water use [m3/s], depending on the availability of discharge

textvar.name: WaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water use at gauging stations

textvar.name: StepsWaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Number of sub-steps needed for water use routine

textvar.name: maxNoWateruse
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating the use of water = distance water is taken for water consuption

textvar.name: WUsePercRemain
textvar.comment: percentage of water which remains in the channel e.g. 0.2 -> 20 percent of discharge is not taken out

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - leave GwLossFraction at 0 unless prior information show groundwater loss is important - use UpperZoneTimeConstant, LowerZoneTimeConstant, GwPercValue as calibration constants - calibrate on GwLossFraction if necessary

textvar.name: LZSmoothRange
textvar.comment: width [number of cells] of the window used to smooth groundwater depletion in the lower zone after groundwater abstraction

textvar.name: GroundwaterBodies
textvar.comment: map of aquifers (0/1), used to smoothen the groundwater lower zone near extraction areas $(PathMaps)/gwbodiesNew.map

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - Use TransSub as calibration constant leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: TransSub
textvar.comment: Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransPower1
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransArea
textvar.comment: PBchange downstream area taking into account for transmission loss

textvar.name: UpAreaTrans
textvar.comment: upstream area

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - Use CalChanMan as calibration constant to fine-tune timing of channel routing, leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: beta
textvar.comment: kinematic wave parameter beta [-]: 0.6 is for broad sheet flow

textvar.name: OFDepRef
textvar.comment: Reference depth of overland flow [mm], used to compute overland flow Alpha for kinematic wave

textvar.name: GradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum slope gradient [-] (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

textvar.name: ChanGradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum channel gradient [-] (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

group.comment: Important: do not change, default value of 0.4 generally combines sufficient numerical accuracy within a limited number of sub-steps

textvar.name: CourantCrit
textvar.comment: Minimum value for Courant condition in soil moisture routine. Always less than or equal to 1. Small values result in improved numerical accuracy, at the expense of increased computing time (more sub-steps needed). If reported time series of soil moisture contain large jumps, lowering CourantCrit should fix this

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: OFDirectInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], direct runoff fraction default: 0 [m3]

textvar.name: OFOtherInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], other fraction

textvar.name: OFForestInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], forest fraction

textvar.name: SnowCoverAInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexInitValue
textvar.comment: initial Frost Index value [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumIntInitValue
textvar.comment: water stored as cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZInitValue
textvar.comment: water stored in the groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall [days]

group.comment: The following variables can also be initialized in the model internally. if you want this to happen, set them to bogus value -9999

textvar.name: ThetaInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content in layer 1a (superficial soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content layer 1b (upper soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content layer 2 (lower soil layer) [mm3/mm3] -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: LZInitValue
textvar.comment: water stored in the groundwater lower zone [mm] -9999: use steady-state storage

textvar.name: TotalCrossSectionAreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial cross-sectional area of flow in channel [m2] -9999: use half bankfull

textvar.name: CrossSection2AreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial channel cross-section area [m2] for 2nd routing channel, i.e., overbank flow -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevSideflowInitValue
textvar.comment: initial lateral inflow for 1st line of routing [m2/s] -9999: use 0

textvar.name: LakeInitialLevelValue
textvar.comment: Initial lake level [m] -9999 sets initial value to steady-state level

textvar.name: LakePrevInflowValue
textvar.comment: Lake inflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value equal to PrevDischarge (ChanQ(t))

textvar.name: LakePrevOutflowValue
textvar.comment: Lake outflow at previous routing sub-step (ChanQ(t-1)) [m3/s] -9999 sets initial value

textvar.name: PrevDischarge
textvar.comment: initial discharge [m3/s] from previous run for lakes, reservoirs and transmission loss ChanQ only needed for lakes reservoirs and transmission loss -9999: use 0

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: CumIntForestInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZForestInitValue
textvar.comment: water in upper groundwater store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRForestInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: CumIntIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: water stored in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower soil layer) -9999: use field capacity values

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: CumIntSealedInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: PrefixPrecipitation
textvar.comment: prefix for precipitation maps

textvar.name: PrefixTavg
textvar.comment: prefix for average temperature maps

textvar.name: PrefixE0
textvar.comment: prefix for potential evaporation rate from open water surface (E0) maps

textvar.name: PrefixES0
textvar.comment: prefix for potential evaporation from soil (ES0) maps

textvar.name: PrefixET0
textvar.comment: prefix for potential reference evapotranspiration (ET0) maps

textvar.name: PrefixLAIForest
textvar.comment: prefix for leaf area index (LAI) maps for the forest land use fraction

textvar.name: PrefixLAIIrrigation
textvar.comment: prefix for leaf area index (LAI) maps for the irrigation land use fraction

textvar.name: PrefixLAIOther
textvar.comment: prefix for leaf area index (LAI) maps for the other land use fraction

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseDomestic
textvar.comment: prefix for domestic water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseLivestock
textvar.comment: prefix for livestock water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseEnergy
textvar.comment: prefix for energy water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixWaterUseIndustry
textvar.comment: prefix for industry water use maps

textvar.name: PrefixVarWaterFraction
textvar.comment: prefix for variable water fraction

group.comment: These all need to have some (real or bogus) value, even for options that are not actually used!

textvar.name: DtSecReservoirs
textvar.comment: Sub time step used for reservoir simulation [s]. Within the model, the smallest out of "DtSecReservoirs" and "DtSec" is used.

textvar.name: ReservoirInitialFillValue
textvar.comment: Initial reservoir fill fraction [-] -9999 sets initial fill to normal storage limit if you're not using the reservoir option, enter some bogus value

textvar.name: TabLakeAvNetInflowEstimate
textvar.comment: Estimate of average net inflow into lake (=inflow - evaporation) [m3 / s] It is used to calculate steady-state lake level in case "LakeInitialLevelValue" is set to -9999

textvar.name: mu
textvar.comment: Weir constant [-] (Do not change!)

textvar.name: PolderInitialLevelValue
textvar.comment: Initial water level in polder [m]

textvar.name: CourantDynamicCrit
textvar.comment: Critical Courant number for dynamic wave. Values range between 0-1 (smaller values result in greater numerical accuracy, but also increase computational time)

textvar.name: DynWaveConstantHeadBoundary
textvar.comment: Constant head [m] at most downstream pixel (relative to altitude at most downstream pixel)

textvar.name: InflowPoints
textvar.comment: OPTIONAL: nominal map with locations of (measured) inflow hydrographs [m3 / s]

textvar.name: QInTS
textvar.comment: OPTIONAL: observed or simulated input hydrographs as time series [m3 / s] Note that identifiers in time series correspond to InflowPoints map (also optional)

textvar.name: HeadMax
textvar.comment: Maximum capillary head [cm]. This value is used if Theta equals residual soil moisture content (value of HeadMax is arbitrary). Only needed for pF computation, otherwise doesn't influence model results at all)

group.comment: PF MAPS

textvar.name: PF1ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a, forest land use fraction

textvar.name: PF2ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b, forest land use fraction

textvar.name: PF3ForestMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF layer 2, forest land use fraction

textvar.name: PF1IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a, irrigated land use fraction

textvar.name: PF2IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b, irrigated land use fraction

textvar.name: PF3IrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 2, irrigated land use fraction

textvar.name: PF1OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1a for the other land use fraction

textvar.name: PF2OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 1b for the other land use fraction

textvar.name: PF3OtherMaps
textvar.comment: Reported pF soil layer 2 for the other land use fraction

lfbinding.comment: More lowe-level control over model in- and output

textvar.name: proj4_params
textvar.comment: This is necessary when using projected coordinates (x,y)

textvar.name: MaskMap
textvar.comment: Clone map

textvar.name: Latitude
textvar.comment: latitude map to be used for snow/ice modelling

textvar.name: netCDFtemplate
textvar.comment: netcdf template used to copy metadata information for writing netcdf

textvar.name: CalendarConvention
textvar.comment: Calendar convention

textvar.name: CalendarDayStart
textvar.comment: Calendar day is back! Calendar day number of 1st day in model run e.g. 1st of January: 1; 1st of June 151 (or 152 in leap year) Needed to read out LAI tables correctly

textvar.name: DtSec
textvar.comment: timestep [seconds] (60*60*24)

textvar.name: DtSecChannel
textvar.comment: Sub time step used for kinematic wave channel routing [seconds] Within the model,the smallest out of DtSecChannel and DtSec is used

textvar.name: StepStart
textvar.comment: Number of first time step in simulation

textvar.name: StepEnd
textvar.comment: Number of last time step in simulation

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - leave all these parameters at their default values. in some very special cases CalEvaporation may be set to some value other than one

textvar.name: PrScaling
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to potential precipitation rates [-]

textvar.name: CalEvaporation
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to potential evapo(transpi)ration rates [-]

textvar.name: LeafDrainageTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant for water in interception store [days]

textvar.name: kdf
textvar.comment: Average extinction coefficient [-] for the diffuse radiation flux varies with crop from 0.4 to 1.1 (Goudriaan (1977))

textvar.name: AvWaterRateThreshold
textvar.comment: Critical amount of available water (expressed in [mm/day]!), above which 'Days Since Last Rain' parameter is set to 1

textvar.name: SMaxSealed
textvar.comment: maximum depression storage for water on impervious surface which is not immediatly causing surface runoff [mm]

textvar.name: WFractionMaps
textvar.comment: water use daily maps with a (in this case negative) volume of water [cu m/s]

textvar.name: WFracOfDay
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: FracMaxWater
textvar.comment: Percentage of maximum extend of water

textvar.name: LakeMask
textvar.comment: Mask with Lakes from GLWD database

textvar.name: maxNoEva
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating evaporation = distance water is taken to satisfy the need of evaporation from open water

textvar.name: EvaOpenMaps
textvar.comment: Reported evaporation from open water [mm]

textvar.name: EvaOpenTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water evaporation from open water at gauging stations

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - estimate SnowFactor from prior data (if available), otherwise use 1 - use SnowMeltCoef as a calibration constant - leave all other parameters at default

textvar.name: SnowFactor
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to precipitation that falls as snow

textvar.name: SnowMeltCoef
textvar.comment: Snowmelt coefficient [mm C-1 day-1)] See also Martinec et al., 1998.

textvar.name: SnowSeasonAdj
textvar.comment: range [mm C-1 day-1] of the seasonal variation SnowMeltCoef is the average value

textvar.name: TempMelt
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] at which snow melts

textvar.name: TempSnow
textvar.comment: Average temperature [deg C] below which precipitation is snow

textvar.name: TemperatureLapseRate
textvar.comment: Temperature lapse rate with altitude [deg C / m]

textvar.name: Afrost
textvar.comment: Daily decay coefficient [day-1], (Handbook of Hydrology, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: Kfrost
textvar.comment: Snow depth reduction coefficient, [cm-1], (HH, p. 7.28)

textvar.name: SnowWaterEquivalent
textvar.comment: Snow water equivalent, (based on snow density of 450 kg/m3) (e.g. Tarboton and Luce, 1996)

textvar.name: FrostIndexThreshold
textvar.comment: Degree Days Frost Threshold (stops infiltration, percolation and capillary rise) Molnau and Bissel found a value 56-85 for NW USA.

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - use b_Xinanjiang and PowerPrefFlow as calibration constants

textvar.name: b_Xinanjiang
textvar.comment: Power in Xinanjiang distribution function [-]

textvar.name: PowerPrefFlow
textvar.comment: Power that controls increase of proportion of preferential flow with increased soil moisture storage [-]

group.comment:
Suggested parameterisation strategy:
- leave GwLossFraction at 0 unless prior information show groundwater loss is important - use all other parameters as calibration constants

textvar.name: UpperZoneTimeConstant
textvar.comment: Time constant for water in upper zone [days]

textvar.name: LowerZoneTimeConstant
GwPercValue
textvar.comment: Maximum rate of percolation going from the Upper to the Lower response box [mm/day]

textvar.name: GwLoss
textvar.comment: Maximum percolation rate from the lower groundwater zone [mm/days]. GWLoss it’s lost beyond the catchment boundaries or to deep groundwater systems. A value of 0 (closed lower boundary) is recommended as a starting value.

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - Use TransSub as calibration constant leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: TransPower1
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransSub
textvar.comment: PBchange Transmission loss function parameter

textvar.name: TransArea
textvar.comment: PBchange downstream area taking into account for transmission loss

textvar.name: UpAreaTrans
textvar.comment: upstream area

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - Use CalChanMan as calibration constant to fine-tune timing of channel routing, leave all other parameters at default values

textvar.name: CalChanMan
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to Channel Manning's n

textvar.name: CalChanMan2
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to Channel Manning's n for second routing line

textvar.name: QSplitMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to average Q to split into a second line of routing

textvar.name: ChanBottomWMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanBottomWidth

textvar.name: ChanDepthTMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanDepthThreshold

textvar.name: ChanSMult
textvar.comment: Multiplier applied to ChanSdXdY

textvar.name: beta
textvar.comment: kinematic wave parameter: 0.6 is for broad sheet flow

textvar.name: OFDepRef
textvar.comment: Reference depth of overland flow [mm], used to compute overland flow Alpha for kin. wave

textvar.name: GradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum slope gradient (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

textvar.name: ChanGradMin
textvar.comment: Minimum channel gradient (for kin. wave: slope cannot be 0)

group.comment: Important: do not change, default value of 0.4 generally combines sufficient numerical accuracy within a limited number of sub-steps

textvar.name: CourantCrit
textvar.comment: Minimum value for Courant condition in soil moisture routine. Always less than or equal to 1. Small values result in improved numerical accuracy, at the expense of increased computing time (more sub-steps needed). If reported time series of soil moisture contain large jumps, lowering CourantCrit should fix this

group.comment: can be either maps or single values

textvar.name: LZAvInflowMap
textvar.comment: Reported map of average percolation rate from upper to lower groundwater zone (reported for end of simulation) [mm/day] Do not include extension, since LISFLOOD already defines the .nc (netCDF) extension

textvar.name: AvgDis
textvar.comment: Average discharge map [m3/s] used to define when to use the second line in the channel split routing Do not include extension, since LISFLOOD already defines the .nc (netCDF) extension

textvar.name: timestepInit
textvar.comment: if init condition are stored as netCDF with different time steps this variable indicates which time step to use Either as date e.g. 1/1/2010 or as number e.g. 5

textvar.name: OFDirectInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], direct runoff fraction

textvar.name: OFOtherInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], other fraction

textvar.name: OFForestInitValue
textvar.comment: Initial overland flow storage [m3], forest fraction

textvar.name: SnowCoverAInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone A [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverBInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone B [mm]

textvar.name: SnowCoverCInitValue
textvar.comment: initial snow depth in snow zone C [mm]

textvar.name: FrostIndexInitValue
textvar.comment: initial Frost Index value [degC/day]

textvar.name: CumIntInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall

group.comment: The following variables can also be initialized in the model internally. if you want this to happen set them to bogus value of -9999

textvar.name: LZInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater lower store [mm] -9999: use steady-state storage

textvar.name: TotalCrossSectionAreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial cross-sectional area of flow in channel[m2] -9999: use half bankfull

textvar.name: ThetaInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CrossSection2AreaInitValue
textvar.comment: initial channel cross-section area [m2] for 2nd routing channel -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevSideflowInitValue
textvar.comment: initial lateral inflow for 1st line of routing [m2/s] -9999: use 0

textvar.name: PrevDischarge
textvar.comment: initial discharge [m3/s] from previous run for lakes, reservoirs and transmission loss only needed for lakes reservoirs and transmission loss -9999: use 0

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: CumIntForestInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZForestInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRForestInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall for forest fraction

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaForestInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

group.comment: maps or single values

textvar.name: CumIntIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative interception [mm]

textvar.name: UZIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: water in groundwater upper store [mm]

textvar.name: DSLRIrrigationInitValue
textvar.comment: days since last rainfall for irrigation

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit1Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1a (superficial layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit2Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 1b (upper layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: ThetaIrrigationInit3Value
textvar.comment: initial soil moisture content [mm3/mm3] layer 2 (lower layer) -9999: use field capacity values

textvar.name: CumIntSealedInitValue
textvar.comment: cumulative depression storage [mm]

textvar.name: PrecipitationMaps
textvar.comment: precipitation [mm/day]

textvar.name: TavgMaps
textvar.comment: average daily temperature [C]

textvar.name: E0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evaporation (free water) [mm/day]

textvar.name: ES0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evaporation (soil) [mm/day]

textvar.name: ET0Maps
textvar.comment: daily reference evapotranspiration (crop) [mm/day]

textvar.name: LAIOtherMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIForestMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIIrrigationMaps
textvar.comment: leaf area index [m2/m2]

textvar.name: LAIOfDay
textvar.comment: table with days for each LAI maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of LAI map

textvar.name: FirstDayOfMonth
textvar.comment: table with days for each water use maps 1st column: range of days; 2nd column: suffix of wuse map

textvar.name: DomesticDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Domestic water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: LivestockDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Livestock water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: EnergyDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Energy water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: IndustrialDemandMaps
textvar.comment: Industry water abstraction daily maps [mm]

textvar.name: LivestockConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for livestock water use (0-1)

textvar.name: IndustryConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for industrial water use (0-1)

textvar.name: EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for energy water use (0-1) Source: Torcellini et al. (2003) "Consumptive Use for US Power Production" map advised by Neil Edwards, Energy Industry the UK and small French rivers the consumptive use varies between 1:2 and 1:3, so 0.33-0.50 For plants along big rivers like Rhine and Danube the 0.025 is ok EnergyConsumptiveUseFraction=0.025

textvar.name: DomesticConsumptiveUseFraction
textvar.comment: Consumptive Use (1-Recycling ratio) for domestic water use (0-1) Source: EEA (2005) State of Environment

textvar.name: LeakageFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of leakage of public water supply (0=no leakage, 1=100% leakage)

textvar.name: LeakageWaterLoss
textvar.comment: The water that is lost from leakage (lost) (0-1)

textvar.name: LeakageReductionFraction
textvar.comment: Leakage reduction fraction (e.g. 50% = 0.5 as compared to current Leakage) (baseline=0, maximum=1)

textvar.name: WaterSavingFraction
textvar.comment: Water savings fraction (e.g. 10% = 0.1 as compared to current Use (baseline=0, maximum=1) scenwsav.map

textvar.name: WaterReUseFraction
textvar.comment: Fraction of water re-used in industry (e.g. 50% = 0.5 = half of the water is re-used, used twice (baseline=0, maximum=1 scenruse.map

textvar.name: IrrigationEfficiency
textvar.comment: Field application irrigation efficiency max 1, ~0.90 drip irrigation, ~0.75 sprinkling

textvar.name: ConveyanceEfficiency
textvar.comment: conveyance efficiency, around 0.80 for average channel

textvar.name: IrrigationType
textvar.comment: IrrigationType (value between 0 and 1) is used here to distinguish between additional adding water until fieldcapacity (value set to 1) or not (value set to 0)

textvar.name: IrrigationMult
textvar.comment: Factor to irrigation water demand More than the transpiration is added e.g to prevent salinisation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseM3
textvar.comment: Annual amount (m3) of treated wastewater reused for irrigation

textvar.name: IrrigationWaterReUseNumDays
textvar.comment: Number of days over which the annual amount of treated wastewater for irrigation is used

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropCoef
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop coefficient

textvar.name: MapIrrigationCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: Irrigation crop group number

textvar.name: Population
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: PopulationMaps
textvar.comment: Population

textvar.name: LandUseMask
textvar.comment: Land Use Mask

textvar.name: WaterUseMaps
textvar.comment: Reported water use [cu m/s], depending on the availability of discharge

textvar.name: WaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Time series of upstream water use at gauging stations

textvar.name: StepsWaterUseTS
textvar.comment: Number of sub-steps needed for water use routine

textvar.name: maxNoWateruse
textvar.comment: maximum number of loops for calculating the use of water = distance water is taken for water consuption

textvar.name: WUsePercRemain
textvar.comment: percentage of water which remains in the channel e.g. 0.2 -> 20 percent of discharge is not taken out

textvar.name: RiceFlooding
textvar.comment: water amount in mm per day 10 mm for 10 days (total 10cm water)

textvar.name: RicePercolation
textvar.comment: FAO: percolation for heavy clay soils: PERC = 2 mm/day

textvar.name: RicePlantingDay1
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RiceHarvestDay1
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RicePlantingDay2
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: RiceHarvestDay2
textvar.comment: map with starting day of the year

textvar.name: Ldd
textvar.comment: local drain direction map (1-9) $(PathTopography)/ldd.map

textvar.name: Grad
textvar.comment: slope gradient [-] (0.50 -> tangent=0.5, angle=26.5 degrees)

textvar.name: ElevationStD
textvar.comment: Elevation standard deviation [m], i.e. altitude difference elevation within pixel. Used for sub-pixel modelling of snow accumulation and melt

textvar.name: Gauges
textvar.comment: Nominal map with gauge locations (i.e cells for which simulated discharge is written to file(1,2,3 etc) outlets.map

textvar.name: Sites
textvar.comment: map with monitoring sites (1,2,3 etc)

textvar.name: PixelLengthUser
textvar.comment: optional map with pixel length [m], only needed in case map attributes are not in [m] (e.g. lat / lon systems)

textvar.name: PixelAreaUser
textvar.comment: optional map with pixel area [m2], only needed in case map attributes are not in [m] (e.g. lat / lon systems)

group.comment: Suggested parameterisation strategy: - use b_Xinanjiang and PowerPrefFlow as calibration constants

textvar.name: SoilDepth1
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 1st layer: 1a (superficial layer) Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for superficial soil layer For Europe it is 50 mm For Africa it is 200 mm

textvar.name: SoilDepth2
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 2nd layer: 1b (upper layer) Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for second soil layer

textvar.name: SoilDepth3
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 2nd layer: 2 (lower layer) Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for second soil layer

textvar.name: SoilDepth1Forest
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 1st layer: 1a Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for upper soil layer For Europe it is 50 mm For Africa it is 200 mm

textvar.name: SoilDepth2Forest
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 2nd layer: 1b Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for lower soil layer

textvar.name: SoilDepth3Forest
textvar.comment: Soil depth for 2nd layer: 2 Minimum Soil Depth [mm] for lower soil layer 300

textvar.name: DirectRunoffFraction
textvar.comment: urban area (0-1)

textvar.name: DirectRunoffFractionMaps
textvar.comment: stack of Direct Runoff fraction maps (0-1)

textvar.name: ForestFraction
textvar.comment: forest fraction of a pixel (0-1)

textvar.name: ForestFractionMaps
textvar.comment: stack of forest fraction maps (0-1) $(PathLandUseChange)/

textvar.name: WaterFraction
textvar.comment: fraction of a pixel covered by water bodies (0-1)

textvar.name: WaterFractionMaps
textvar.comment: $(PathLandUseChange)/ stack of water fraction maps (0-1)

textvar.name: OtherFraction
textvar.comment: fraction of a pixel covered by other uses (0-1)

textvar.name: OtherFractionMaps
textvar.comment: $(PathLandUseChange)/ stack of other fraction maps (0-1)

textvar.name: IrrigationFraction
textvar.comment: irrigated area fraction of a pixel (0-1)

textvar.name: IrrigationFractionMaps
textvar.comment: $(PathLandUseChange)/ stack of Irrigation fraction maps (0-1)

textvar.name: DrainedFraction
textvar.comment: $(PathLandUse)/fracDrained.map drained fraction from irrigated area (0-1)

textvar.name: RiceFraction
textvar.comment: rice fraction of a pixel (0-1)

textvar.name: RiceFractionMaps
textvar.comment: stack of rice fraction maps (0-1)

textvar.name: FractionGroundwaterUsed
textvar.comment: groundwater used fraction of a pixel (0-1)

textvar.name: FractionNonConventionalWaterUsed
textvar.comment: NonConventionalWaterUsed (0-1)

textvar.name: FractionLakeReservoirWaterUsed
textvar.comment: lake and reservoir water used, fraction of a pixel (0-1)

textvar.name: EFlowThreshold
textvar.comment: Environmental flow threshold [m3/s[ below which water abstraction stops. E.g. the 10th percentile discharge of the baseline run $(PathMaps)/eflow.map

textvar.name: MapCropCoef
textvar.comment: map with crop coefficient for each land use; values ranging from 0.75 to 1.25; source: Supit, p.83 CFET

textvar.name: MapCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: map with crop group number; table 6.1 and 6.2 in WOFOST 6.0, Supit, 1994: p. 86

textvar.name: MapN
textvar.comment: $(PathLandCover)/manngs_2000_250m.map table with Manning's roughness [m^(1/3) s^(-1)] for each CORINE landcover class

textvar.name: MapForestCropCoef
textvar.comment: map with crop coefficient for each land use; values ranging from 0.75 to 1.25; source: Supit, p.83 CFET

textvar.name: MapForestCropGroupNumber
textvar.comment: map with crop group number; table 6.1 and 6.2 in WOFOST 6.0, Supit, 1994: p. 86

textvar.name: MapForestN
textvar.comment: map with Manning's roughness [m^(1/3) s^(-1)] for each CORINE landcover class

textvar.name: UpLimit
textvar.comment: UpArea do be included in max. celerity

textvar.name: NoSubStepsChan
textvar.comment: variable Number of sub steps for the kinematic wave routing

textvar.name: Channels
textvar.comment: Boolean map with value 1 at channel pixels and 0 at all other pixels IMPORTANT: IF NON-CHANNEL PIXELS HAVE MISSING VALUES, THEN THIS MAY RESULT IN INCORRECT RESULTS

textvar.name: ChanGrad
textvar.comment: Channel gradient (fraction, dy/dx)

textvar.name: ChanMan
textvar.comment: Channel Manning's n [m^(1/3) s^(-1)]

textvar.name: ChanLength
textvar.comment: Channel length [m]

textvar.name: ChanBottomWidth
textvar.comment: Channel bottom width [m]

textvar.name: ChanSdXdY
textvar.comment: Channel side slope, expressed as gradient !! expressed as dx/dy !!! (NOT dy/dx, which would perhaps be more logical)

textvar.name: FloodPlainWidth
textvar.comment: Floodplain Width [m]

textvar.name: ChanDepthThreshold
textvar.comment: Bankfull channel depth [m]

group.comment: Each parameter is defined for upper (1a and 1b) and lower (2) soil layers

textvar.comment: Soil moisture content at saturation [V/V] [mm3/mm3] for soil layer 1a (superficial soil layer)

textvar.name: MapThetaSat2

textvar.comment: Residual soil moisture content [V/V] [mm3/mm3] for soil layer 1b (upper soil layer)

textvar.name: MapThetaRes3
textvar.comment: Residual soil moisture content [V/V] [mm3/mm3] for soil layer 2 (lower soil layer)

textvar.name: MapLambda1

textvar.comment: Pore-size index (Van Genuchten m and n are calculated from this) Lambda is acually 1-n [-]

textvar.name: MapLambda3
textvar.comment: Pore-size index (Van Genuchten m and n are calculated from this) Lambda is acually 1-n [-]

textvar.name: MapGenuAlpha1
textvar.comment: Van Genuchten parameter Alpha [1/cm] for soil layer 1a (superficial soil layer)

textvar.comment: Van Genuchten parameter Alpha [1/cm] for soil layer 1b (upper soil layer)

textvar.name: MapGenuAlpha3
textvar.comment: Van Genuchten parameter Alpha [1/cm] for soil layer 2 (lower soil layer)

textvar.name: MapKSat1
textvar.comment: Saturated conductivity [mm/day] for soil layer 1a (superficial soil layer)

textvar.name: MapKSat2
textvar.comment: Saturated conductivity [mm/day] for soil layer 1b (upper soil layer)

textvar.name: MapThetaSat2Forest
textvar.comment: Soil moisture content at saturation [V/V] [mm3/mm3]

textvar.name: MapThetaRes1Forest
textvar.comment: Residual soil moisture content [V/V] [mm3/mm3] for soil layer 1a (superficial soil layer)

textvar.name: MapGenuAlpha2Forest
textvar.comment: Van Genuchten parameter Alpha [1/cm] for soil layer 1b (upper soil layer)

textvar.name: MapKSat1Forest
textvar.comment: Saturated conductivity [mm/day] for soil layer 1a (superficial soil layer)

textvar.name: MapKSat2Forest
textvar.comment: Saturated conductivity [mm/day] for soil layer 1b (upper soil layer)

textvar.name: DtSecReservoirs
textvar.comment: Sub time step used for reservoir simulation [s]. Within the model, the smallest out of DtSecReservoirs and DtSec is used.

textvar.name: ReservoirSites
textvar.comment: Map with the location of reservoirs (number)

textvar.name: ReservoirInitialFillValue
textvar.comment: Initial reservoir storage (fraction)

textvar.name: TabTotStorage
textvar.comment: Total reservoir storage capacity [m3]

textvar.name: TabConservativeStorageLimit
textvar.comment: Conservative reservoir storage (fraction, typically 0.07)

textvar.name: TabNormalStorageLimit
textvar.comment: Normal reservoir storage limit (fraction, typically 0.65)

textvar.name: TabFloodStorageLimit
textvar.comment: Flood reservoir storage limit (fraction, typically 0.90)

textvar.name: TabNonDamagingOutflowQ
textvar.comment: Non damaging reservoir outflow Q [m3 / s]

textvar.name: TabNormalOutflowQ
